snippet: The former secretary of state said that her messages to other officials were preserved on government servers, but the State Department said it had failed to routinely preserve such emails.
abstract: State Dept acknowledges patchwork system for preserving senior officials' emails and that it largely relied on individual employees to determine whether emails were public records; revelations suggest that some emails from Hillary Rodham Clinton to other department officials may have been lost altogether; system reflects broad confusion throughout government agencies as they try to catch up to digital age.

byline.original: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS

lead_paragraph: The former secretary of state said that her messages to other officials were preserved on government servers, but the State Department said it had failed to routinely preserve such emails.

headline.main: Emails Hillary Clinton Said Were Kept Could Be Lost
headline.print_headline: Emails Clinton Said Were Kept Could Be Lost
